title: India seeks rupee status symbol
content:
[It has billionaires and big ambitions. Now India wants something that no global economic powerhouse should be without: an international symbol for its currency.](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803024438/http:/news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/magazine/7923825.stm)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803024438im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_45550314_currencies_226x170_3712.gif)
author: satya

comments.content:
As Simon said, there is already a Unicode slot for the Rupee currency symbol, and a recommended form, which I have rendered in several fonts, e.g:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803024438im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rs_3579.jpg)
  
But it's not really in the same league as the leading monetary symbols, and doesn't work with "1", so I can see why some people might think it needs an upgrade.

May I suggest an international symbol of the Rupee?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803024438im_/http:/typophile.com/files/videoGameCurrencies_legendofzelda_4256.jpg)
^ That's what immediately came to mind. What's the reward for the winning design? I could use some red potion.
